wikipedia_page.main: Dr James Millar (or Miller)  (1762–1827) was a Scottish physician, botanist and author. He edited the fourth and fifth editions of the Encyclopædia Britannica.Although a good writer on scientific topics, he was deemed a poor chief editor of the Britannica, being "slow and dilatory and not well qualified".

response: *James Millar (physician) (1762–1827), Scottish physician and editor of the Encyclopædia Britannica
*James Millar (Australian actor) (born 1980), Australian actor, singer and writer
*James Millar (skier), Paralympian who represented Australia at the Winter Olympics in 2006 and 2010

The Encyclopædia Edinensis was a six-volume general encyclopedia published in Edinburgh in 1827, and intended for a popular audience. It was edited by James Millar, who died just before it was complete.

*Jeremiah Kirby and Richard Poole, main editors and contributors.James Millar, Encyclopedia Edinensis; or, Dictionary of arts, sciences, and literature vol. 1 (1827), p. vi; archive.org. Poole wrote articles on "Mental Diseases".

Poole studied Medicine and graduated M.D. at the University of St Andrews in 1805. He was editor of the New Edinburgh Review, and published articles promoting phrenology in the early 1820s; it existed 1821 to 1823. Poole was also first editor of the Phrenological Journal. Poole joined the editorial staff of the Encyclopædia Edinensis under James Millar.James Millar (1827) Encyclopedia Edinensis; or, Dictionary of arts, sciences, and literature vol. 1, p. vi.
* 4 February – James Millar, physician and encyclopædist (died 1827)
